intro: Linanthus pungens subsp. hazeliae, commonly known as the hazel linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Evening Primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
